subject: Relationships
title: Declining Marriage Rates Worldwide
description: Learn Declining Marriage Rates Worldwide in one minute.

hook.text: In 1970, 85% of American adults had been married. Today it's 50%. Marriage is becoming optional, not expected.

buildup.text: Marriage rates are declining across all developed nations. Scandinavia, Japan, and South Korea lead the trend.

discovery.text: The decline correlates with women's economic independence. When women can earn, marriage becomes a choice, not survival.

twist.text: In South Korea, only 35% of young adults plan to marry. The 'marriage strike' reflects economics, not apathy.

climax.text: Marriage isn't dying. It's transforming from a necessity into an option â€” and options require better reasons.

punchline.text: Marriage isn't dying. It's becoming optional. That changes everything.
